slug: This is a non-exhaustive collection of media quoting Justin. Media featuring Justin in a larger role can be found in the other sections of this page.

items.title: It's All About the Money (and Healthcare)
items.desc: This podcast examines the difficulties that people with disabilities have finding work. Recorded during the early stages of the COVID-19 pandemic, there is an emphasis on the transition to remote work. Justin discussed his experiences working remotely since the beginning of the pandemic and how the transition to remote work could open up more opportunities for people with disabilities.

items.title: Interview with Justin Yarbrough
items.desc: Justin spoke with Denis Boudreau about his experiences attending live live in-person and virtual training and speaking events as a blind person.

items.title: US airlines seek to honor disability rights while enforcing mask use
items.desc: Article examining how airlines were trying to accommodate passengers with disabilities that were unable to wear masks early in the pandemic after airlines had started to require masks be worn on planes. While Justin's disability does not prevent him from wearing a mask, he was concerned how the policies would affect passengers who were unable to wear them.

items.title: How one Diamondbacks fan refused to let going blind dim his love for baseball
items.desc: Profile by Zach Buchanan, former Diamondbacks beat writer for The Athletic about Justin's blindness journey and his love for baseball. A subscription is required to read the full article.

items.title: Meet Justin, Steve and Trudy at axe-con 2023!
items.desc: Promotional video recorded for an axe-con panel Justin participated in discussing working in accessibility while having a disability.

items.title: Living with Blindness: Interview with Justin Yarbrough
items.desc: Interview conducted with Rio Salado College librarian Kirstin Thomas as part of Rio's recognition of the 31st anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act being signed into law.
